member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheBuilderExtMethods.WithRegisteredMemoryCache(ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.IFusionCacheBuilder)
member.summary:
The builder will look for an service registered in the DI container and use it, and throws if it cannot find one.
WARNING: normally the memory cache is registered in the DI container as a SINGLETON. This means that, if you use multiple named caches and also use WithRegisteredMemoryCache() on all of them, they will use THE SAME memory cache and without extra care in creating cache keys YOU MAY HAVE COLLISIONS.
To avoid this, either don't use WithRegisteredMemoryCache() and let FusionCache create one for you (which will be different per cache instance) or use WithMemoryCache() and provide one directly.
NOTE: if a memory cache is not found, an will be thrown. To avoid this and use a best-effort behavior, use TryWithRegisteredMemoryCache().
DOCS:
member.param: The to act upon.
member.returns: The so that additional calls can be chained.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheBuilderExtMethods.TryWithRegisteredMemoryCache(ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.IFusionCacheBuilder)
member.summary:
Indicates if the builder should try to find and use an service registered in the DI container.
WARNING: normally the memory cache is registered in the DI container as a SINGLETON. This means that, if you use multiple named caches and also use WithRegisteredMemoryCache() on all of them, they will use THE SAME memory cache and without extra care in creating cache keys YOU MAY HAVE COLLISIONS.
To avoid this, either don't use TryWithRegisteredMemoryCache() and let FusionCache create one for you (which will be different per cache instance) or use WithMemoryCache() and provide one directly.
DOCS:

member.returns: The so that additional calls can be chained.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheBuilderExtMethods.WithRegisteredDistributedCache(ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.IFusionCacheBuilder,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
The builder will look for an service (and a corresponding ) registered in the DI container and use them, and throws if it cannot find them.
WARNING: normally the distributed cache is registered in the DI container as a SINGLETON. This means that, if you use multiple named caches and also use WithRegisteredDistributedCache() on all of them, they will use THE SAME distributed cache and without extra care in creating cache keys YOU MAY HAVE COLLISIONS.
One way to avoid collisions is to specify a CacheKeyPrefix by using one of the WithCacheKeyPrefix() methods.
NOTE: if an is not found in the DI container, or if one is found but no is found, an will be thrown. To avoid this and use a best-effort behavior, use TryWithRegisteredDistributedCache().
NOTE: normally if an is found in the DI container, it will be used. In some scenarios though, like when using ASP.NET, one is automatically registered of type : that is not a real distributed cache, but just a memory cache masquerading as a distrbuted one. Since using that would do nothing and is a waste of resources, by default that is ignored. If you want to use it instead, just set the to .
DOCS:
member.param: The to act upon.

Indicates if the distributed cache found in the DI container should be ignored if it is of type , since that is not really a distributed cache and it's automatically registered by ASP.NET MVC without control from the user.
member.returns: The so that additional calls can be chained.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheBuilderExtMethods.TryWithRegisteredDistributedCache(ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.IFusionCacheBuilder,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Indicates if the builder should try to find and use an service (and a corresponding ) registered in the DI container.
WARNING: normally the distributed cache is registered in the DI container as a SINGLETON. This means that, if you use multiple named caches by using WithRegisteredDistributedCache() on all of them, they will use THE SAME distributed cache and without extra care in creating cache keys YOU MAY HAVE COLLISIONS.
One way to avoid collisions is to specify a CacheKeyPrefix by using one of the WithCacheKeyPrefix() methods.
NOTE: if an is found, it can be used. In some scenarios though, like when using ASP.NET, one is automatically registered of type : that is not a real distributed cache, but just a memory cache masquerading as a distrbuted one. Since using that would do nothing and is a waste of resources, by default that is ignored. If you want to use it instead, just set the to .
NOTE: if an is found, a would also be needed: when that is not the case, by default an will be thrown so to avoid surprises at runtime, like thinking that a distributed cache will be used when instead it will not. If you want to avoid this and just have a best-effort approach by ignoring a distributed cache when a serializer is missing, set the param to .
DOCS:
member.param: The to act upon.

Indicates if the distributed cache found in the DI container should be ignored if it is of type , since that is not really a distributed cache and it's automatically registered by ASP.NET MVC without control from the user.

member.summary: Represents all the options available for a single entry.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of a object.
member.param: The value for the property. If null, will be used.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.Duration
member.summary:
The amount of time after which a cache entry is considered expired.
Please note the wording "considered expired" here: what it means is that, although from the OUTSIDE what is observed is always the same (a piece of data logically expires after the specified ), on the INSIDE things change depending on the fact that fail-safe is enabled or not.
More specifically:
- if is set to the corresponds to the actual underlying duration in the cache, nothing more, nothing less
- if is set to , the underlying duration in the cache corresponds to and the property is used internally as a way to indicate when the data should be considered stale (expired), without making it actually expire inside the cache levels (memory and/or distributed)
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.EagerRefreshThreshold
member.summary:
The threshold to apply when deciding whether to refresh the cache entry eagerly (that is, before the actual expiration).
This value is intended as a percentage of the property, expressed as a value between 0.0 and 1.0 (eg: 0.5 = 50%, 0.75 = 75%, etc).
For example by setting it to 0.8 (80%) with a of 10 minutes, if there's a cache access for the entry after 8 minutes (80% of 10 minutes) an eager refresh will automatically start in the background, while immediately returing the (still valid) cached value to the caller.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.LockTimeout
member.summary:
The timeout to apply when trying to acquire a memory lock during a factory execution.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.JitterMaxDuration
member.summary: The maximum amount of extra duration to add to the normal to allow for more variable expirations.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.Size
member.summary:
The size of the cache entry, used as a value of in the underlying memory cache.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.Priority
member.summary: The of the entry in the underlying memory cache.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.IsFailSafeEnabled
member.summary:
Enable the fail-safe mechanism, which will be activated if and when something goes wrong while calling a factory or getting data from a distributed cache.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.FailSafeMaxDuration
P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.FailSafeThrottleDuration
member.summary:
If fail-safe is enabled, something goes wrong while getting data (from the distributed cache or while calling the factory) and there is an expired entry to be used as a fallback value, the fail-safe mechanism will actually be activated. In that case the fallback value will not only be returned to the caller but also put in the cache for this duration (usually small) to avoid excessive load on the distributed cache and/or the factory getting called continuously.
TL/DR: the amount of time an expired cache entry is temporarily considered non-expired before checking the source (calling the factory) again.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.FactorySoftTimeout
member.summary:
The maximum execution time allowed for the factory, applied only if fail-safe is enabled and there is a fallback value to return.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.FactoryHardTimeout
member.summary:
The maximum execution time allowed for the factory in any case, even if there is not a stale value to fallback to.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.AllowTimedOutFactoryBackgroundCompletion
member.summary:
It enables a factory that has hit a synthetic timeout (both soft/hard) to complete in the background and update the cache with the new value.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.DistributedCacheDuration
member.summary:
The duration specific for the distributed cache, if any. If not set, will be used.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.DistributedCacheFailSafeMaxDuration
P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.DistributedCacheSoftTimeout
member.summary:
The maximum execution time allowed for each operation on the distributed cache, applied only if fail-safe is enabled and there is a fallback value to return.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.DistributedCacheHardTimeout
member.summary:
The maximum execution time allowed for each operation on the distributed cache in any case, even if there is not a stale value to fallback to.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.AllowBackgroundDistributedCacheOperations
member.summary:
Even if the distributed cache is a secondary level, by default every operation on it (get/set/remove/etc) is blocking: that is to say the FusionCache method call would not return until the inner distributed cache operation is completed.
This is to avoid rare edge cases like saving a value in the cache and immediately cheking the underlying distributed cache directly, not finding the value (because it is still being saved): very very rare, but still.
Setting this flag to will execute most of these operations in the background, resulting in a performance boost.
TL/DR: set this flag to for a perf boost, but watch out for rare side effects.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.ReThrowDistributedCacheExceptions
member.summary:
Set this to to allow the bubble up of distributed cache exceptions (default is ). Please note that, even if set to , in some cases you would also need set to and no timeout (neither soft nor hard) specified.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.ReThrowSerializationExceptions
member.summary:
Set this to to allow the bubble up of serialization exceptions (default is ). Please note that, even if set to , in some cases you would also need set to and no timeout (neither soft nor hard) specified.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.EnableBackplaneNotifications
member.summary:
Enable publishing of backplane notifications after some operations, like a SET (via a Set/GetOrSet call) or a REMOVE (via a Remove call).
DOCS:
OBSOLETE NOW:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.SkipBackplaneNotifications
member.summary:
Skip the usage of the backplane, if any.
Normally, if you have a backplane setup, any change operation (like a SET via a Set/GetOrSet call or a REMOVE via a Remove call) will send backplane notifications: this option can skip it.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.AllowBackgroundBackplaneOperations
member.summary:
By default every operation on the backplane is non-blocking: that is to say the FusionCache method call would not wait for each backplane operation to be completed.
Setting this flag to will execute these operations in a blocking fashion, typically resulting in worse performance.
TL/DR: if you want to wait for backplane operations to complete, set this flag to .
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.ReThrowBackplaneExceptions
member.summary:
Set this to to allow the bubble up of backplane exceptions (default is ). Please note that, even if set to , in some cases you would also need set to and no timeout (neither soft nor hard) specified.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.SkipDistributedCache
member.summary:
Skip the usage of the distributed cache, if any.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.SkipDistributedCacheReadWhenStale
member.summary:
When a 2nd level (distributed cache) is used and a cache entry in the 1st level (memory cache) is found but is stale, a read is done on the distributed cache: the reason is that in a multi-node environment another node may have updated the cache entry, so we may found a newer version of it.
There are situations though, like in a mobile app with a SQLite 2nd level, where the 2nd level is not really "distributed" but just "out of process" (to ease cold starts): in situations like this noone can have updated the 2nd level, so we can skip that extra read for a perf boost (of course the write part will still be done).
TL/DR: if your 2nd level is not "distributed" but only "out of process", setting this to can give you a nice performance boost.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.SkipMemoryCache
member.summary:
Skip the usage of the memory cache.
NOTE: this option must be used very carefully and is generally not recommended, as it will not protect you from some problems like Cache Stampede. Also, it can lead to a lot of extra work for the 2nd level (distributed cache) and a lot of extra network traffic.
DOCS:

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.GetJitterDurationMs
member.summary:
If is greater than , this method returns a randomized duration (in ms) between 0 and that will be added to the entry's specified .
This is done to avoid a variation of the so called Cache Stampede problem that may happen when the entry for the same key expires on multiple nodes at the same time, because of high synchronization.
member.returns: An additional cache duration (in ms) to slightly vary the entry duration

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.SetDurationZero
member.summary: Set the to be zero: this will effectively remove the entry from the cache if fail-safe is disabled, or it will set the entry as logically expired if fail-safe is enabled (so it can be used later as a fallback).
member.returns: The so that additional calls can be chained.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions.SetDurationInfinite
member.summary: Set the to be infinite, so it will never expire. NOTE: the expiration will not be literally "infinite", but it will be set to which in turn is Dec 31st 9999 which, I mean, c'mon. If that time will come and you'll have some problems feel free to try and contact me :-)
member.returns: The so that additional calls can be chained.

member.summary:
Set the option.
NOTE: this option must be used very carefully and is generally not recommended, as it will not protect you from some problems like Cache Stampede. Also, it can lead to a lot of extra work for the 2nd level (distributed cache) and a lot of extra network traffic.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheExtMethods.ExpireAsync(ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.IFusionCache,System.String,System.Action{ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheEntryOptions},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Expires the cache entry for the specified .
In the memory cache:
- if fail-safe is enabled: the entry will marked as logically expired, but will still be available as a fallback value in case of future problems
- if fail-safe is disabled: the entry will be effectively removed
In the distributed cache (if any), the entry will be effectively removed.
member.param: The instance.
The cache key which identifies the entry in the cache.
The setup action used to further configure the newly created object, automatically created by duplicating .
An optional to cancel the operation.
member.returns: A to await the completion of the operation.

member.name: T:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1
member.summary: Models the execution context passed to a FusionCache factory. Right now it just contains the options so they can be modified based of the factory execution (see adaptive caching), but in the future this may contain more.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1.Options
member.summary: The options currently used, and that can be modified or changed completely.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1.StaleValue
member.summary: The stale value, maybe.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1.HasStaleValue
member.summary: Indicates if there is a cached stale value.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1.ETag
member.summary: If provided, it's the ETag of the entry: this may be used in the next refresh cycle (eg: with the use of the "If-None-Match" header in an http request) to check if the entry is changed, to avoid getting the entire value.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1.HasETag
member.summary: Indicates if there is an ETag value for the cached value.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1.LastModified
member.summary: If provided, it's the last modified date of the entry: this may be used in the next refresh cycle (eg: with the use of the "If-Modified-Since" header in an http request) to check if the entry is changed, to avoid getting the entire value.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1.HasLastModified
member.summary: Indicates if there is a LastModified value for the cached value.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1.NotModified
member.summary: For when the value is not modified, so that the stale value can be automatically returned.
member.returns: The stale value, for when it is not changed.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheFactoryExecutionContext`1.Modified(`0,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: For when the value is modified, so that the new value can be returned and cached, along with the ETag and/or the LastModified values.
member.param: The new value.
The new value for the property.
The new value for the property.
member.returns: The new value to be cached.

member.summary: The wire format version separator for the distributed cache wire format, used in the cache key processing.

member.summary: The wire format version identifier for the backplane wire format, used in the channel name.

member.summary: The wire format version separator for the backplane wire format, used in the channel name.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a object.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.CacheName
member.summary:
The name of the cache: it can be used for identification, and in a multi-node scenario it is typically shared between nodes to create a logical association.
NOTE: if you try to set this to a null/whitespace value, that value will be ignored.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.InstanceId
member.summary: The instance id of the cache: it will be used for low-level identification for the same logical cache between different nodes in a multi-node scenario: it is automatically set to a random value.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.SetInstanceId(System.String)
member.summary:
Set the InstanceId of the cache, but please don't use this.
WARNING: again, this should NOT be set, basically never ever, unless you really know what you are doing. For example by using the same value for two different cache instances they will be considered as the same cache, and this will lead to critical errors. So again, really: you should not use this.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.DefaultEntryOptions
member.summary: The default to use when none will be specified, and as the starting point when duplicating one.
member.exception: Thrown if an attempt is made to set this property to .

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.DistributedCacheCircuitBreakerDuration
member.summary:
The duration of the circuit-breaker used when working with the distributed cache. Defaults to , which means the circuit-breaker will never be activated.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.EnableSyncEventHandlersExecution
member.summary:
Execute event handlers in a sync fashion, waiting for all of them to complete before moving on.
WARNING: by default this option is NOT enabled, and should remain this way in any normal circumstance unless you really know what you are doing.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.CacheKeyPrefix
member.summary:
A prefix that will be added to each cache key for each call: it can be useful when working with multiple named caches.
EXAMPLE: if the CacheKeyPrefix specified is "MyCache:", a later call to cache.GetOrDefault("Product/123") will actually work on the cache key "MyCache:Product/123".

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.DistributedCacheKeyModifierMode
member.summary: Specify the mode in which cache key will be changed for the distributed cache, for internal purposes (eg: to specify the wire format version).

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.BackplaneCircuitBreakerDuration
member.summary:
The duration of the circuit-breaker used when working with the backplane. Defaults to , which means the circuit-breaker will never be activated.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.BackplaneChannelPrefix
member.summary:
The prefix to use in the backplane channel name: if not specified the will be used.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.EnableBackplaneAutoRecovery
member.summary:
DEPRECATED: please use EnableAutoRecovery.
Enable auto-recovery for the backplane notifications to better handle transient errors without generating synchronization issues: notifications that failed to be sent out will be retried later on, when the backplane becomes responsive again.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.EnableAutoRecovery
member.summary:
Enable auto-recovery to automatically handle transient errors to minimize synchronization issues.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.BackplaneAutoRecoveryMaxItems
member.summary:
DEPRECATED: please use AutoRecoveryMaxItems.
The maximum number of items in the auto-recovery queue: this can help reducing memory consumption. If set to there will be no limit.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.AutoRecoveryMaxItems
member.summary:
The maximum number of items in the auto-recovery queue: this is usually not needed, but it may help reducing memory consumption in extreme scenarios.
When set to null there will be no limits.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.BackplaneAutoRecoveryMaxRetryCount
member.summary:
DEPRECATED: please use AutoRecoveryMaxRetryCount.
The maximum number of retries for a auto-recovery item: after this amount the item is discarded, to avoid keeping it retrying forever. If set to there will be no limit.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.AutoRecoveryMaxRetryCount
member.summary:
The maximum number of retries for a auto-recovery item: after this amount an item is discarded, to avoid keeping it for too long. Please note though that a cleanup is automatically performed, so in theory there's no need to set this.
When set to there will be no limits.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.BackplaneAutoRecoveryReconnectDelay
member.summary:
DEPRECATED: please use AutoRecoveryDelay.
The amount of time to wait, after a backplane reconnection, before trying to process the auto-recovery queue: this may be useful to allow all the other nodes to be ready.
Use to avoid any delay (risky).
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.BackplaneAutoRecoveryDelay
member.summary:
DEPRECATED: please use AutoRecoveryDelay.
The amount of time to wait before actually processing the auto-recovery queue, to better handle backpressure.
Use to avoid any delay (risky).
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.AutoRecoveryDelay
member.summary:
The amount of time to wait before actually processing the auto-recovery queue, to better handle backpressure.
Use to avoid any delay (risky).
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.EnableDistributedExpireOnBackplaneAutoRecovery
member.summary:
Enable expiring a cache entry, only on the distributed cache (if any), when anauto-recovery message is being published on the backplane, to ensure that the value in the distributed cache will not be stale.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.ReThrowOriginalExceptions
member.summary: If enabled, and re-throwing of exceptions is also enabled (see , or ), it will re-throw the original exception as-is instead of wrapping it into one of the available specific exceptions (, or ).

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.IncoherentOptionsNormalizationLogLevel
member.summary:
Specify the to use when some options have incoherent values that have been fixed with a normalization, like for example when a FailSafeMaxDuration is lower than a Duration, so the Duration is used instead.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.SerializationErrorsLogLevel
member.summary:
Specify the to use when an error occurs during serialization or deserialization while working with the distributed cache.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.DistributedCacheSyntheticTimeoutsLogLevel
member.summary:
Specify the to use when a synthetic timeout occurs during a distributed cache operation.
NOTE: synthetic timeouts are only related to soft/hard timeouts, and are not related to intrinsic timeout exceptions or similar that may be thrown by your distributed cache.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.DistributedCacheErrorsLogLevel
member.summary:
Specify the to use when any error (except for a synthetic timeout) occurs during a distributed cache operation.
DOCS:

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.FactorySyntheticTimeoutsLogLevel

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.FusionCacheOptions.FactoryErrorsLogLevel

member.summary:
Expires the cache entry for the specified .
In the memory cache:
- if fail-safe is enabled: the entry will marked as logically expired, but will still be available as a fallback value in case of future problems
- if fail-safe is disabled: the entry will be effectively removed
In the distributed cache (if any), the entry will be effectively removed.
member.param: The cache key which identifies the entry in the cache.
The options to adhere during this operation. If null is passed, will be used.
An optional to cancel the operation.
member.returns: A to await the completion of the operation.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.Internals.FusionCacheEntryMetadata.#ctor(System.DateTimeOffset,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: The logical expiration of the cache entry: this is used in when the actual expiration in the cache is higher because of fail-safe.
Indicates if the cache entry comes from a fail-safe activation, so if the value was used as a fallback because errors occurred.

If provided, it's the last modified date of the entry: this may be used in the next refresh cycle (eg: with the use of the "If-Modified-Since" header in an http request) to check if the entry is changed, to avoid getting the entire value.

If provided, it's the ETag of the entry: this may be used in the next refresh cycle (eg: with the use of the "If-None-Match" header in an http request) to check if the entry is changed, to avoid getting the entire value.
The eager expiration, based on the .

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.Internals.FusionCacheEntryMetadata.LogicalExpiration
member.summary:
The intended expiration of the entry as requested from the caller.
When fail-safe is enabled the entry is cached with a higher duration () so it may be used as a fallback value in case of problems: when that happens, the LogicalExpiration is used to check if the value is stale, instead of losing it by simply let it expire in the cache.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.Caching.Fusion.Internals.FusionCacheEntryMetadata.IsFromFailSafe
member.summary: Indicates if the cache entry comes from a fail-safe activation, so if the value was used as a fallback because errors occurred.

member.summary: The eager expiration, based on the .

member.summary: If provided, it's the ETag of the entry: this may be used in the next refresh cycle (eg: with the use of the "If-None-Match" header in an http request) to check if the entry is changed, to avoid getting the entire value.
